Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: same m
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel 41. Although we were exhausted after our long flight, The rooms are nice but the best part of this hotel is the service! Every time you go into the executive lounge they are extremely helpful and willing to help in any way they can. We had planned our restaurants beforehand, but if you are not a pre-planner they will be very helpful. The food and drinks in the lounge..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to endulge yourself in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: pan99
Reviews.Content: An extremely pleasant stay in a very confortable "home" in the heart of Madrid. The room was great with a very spacious bathroom. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. Great breakfast choice in a quiet lovely garden. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Philip893
Reviews.Content: The hotel represents exactly what we are looking for nowadays in a big city: five stars "boutique hotel" extremely well located. Service is excellent and the bedrooms are delightful. It is also very quiet and with its own car-park, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Claudy C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an ultra-exclusive area, close to the most chic’s shops and restaurants. We have a fantastic shopping day without cabs or metro. Very trendy, the reception was actually attentive with us. And, of course, we enjoyed the excellent Spanish weather. We have no opportunity to go to Ramón Freixa restaurant but we take the breakfast at the hotel and was really good and complete; with toast, cereals, croissants, natural orange juice… A nice weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be bettered in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PFoggSydney
Reviews.Content: A brilliant small hotel. The location is discrete, in Salamanca, the most upmarket residential and shopping in area in Madrid. The staff were friendly and professional. Every request is quietly sorted. It's great design, within a historical building. A short cab ride to everything you need to see the Prado etc, Good tapas bars within a couple of minutes walk. And the tourist bus hop on and off, 5 minutes walk away. The Unico is fantastic. The restaurant is excellent and the private courtyard it a great place to take in some local life over a very generous gin. I rarely stay I will stay there again, but I must definitely will. L'Unico is small but fabulous hotel and likes people who don't want to be fussed over but who want privacy and service. I can't recommended it enough. Just go there.

Reviews.Title: “a dream for two”
Reviews.Author: Paulo D
Reviews.Content: wonderful stay, excellent atmosphere, very friendly staff, excellent 2 michelin star restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - faultless stay”
Reviews.Author: retep68
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 3 night stay at the Unico towards the end of June 2012. I was initially concerned about the location, but needn’t have worried as it’s very pleasant 20 minute walk to Grand Via, or just 5 minutes to the nearest metro (Madrid’s metro is clean, efficient and relatively cheap). It’s also very close to the Park Del Retiro. The hotel is in Salamanca neighbourhood, which is a nice upmarket area with lots of high end shops and a decent selection of restaurants. We had absolutely no noise issues (we’d booked a garden room, but were upgraded to a junior suite at check-in which overlooked the (quiet) road outside). The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathroom was huge. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but a very quick and efficient room service provided tea and coffee for us each morning (free of charge – or at least I don’t recall seeing a charge for it on the bill). Our suite had a large bathroom. Twin sinks, large walk-in shower, separate Jacuzzi bathtub and separate toilet/bidet area. Plenty of towels. Good dressing gowns provided. Nice turn-down service with bottles of water. We didn’t have breakfast at the hotel or go to the hotel’s 2 Michelin starred restaurant. We did have drinks in the hotel’s garden on a couple of occasions though. A lovely setting and a fantastic place to have a drink before going out for the evening (or when returning after a meal). I would highly recommend this hotel – perfect location, fantastic service and superb rooms – definitely 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: alesims
Reviews.Content: when it comes to the decoration, the hotel is very nice. Our room had only one window, on the the roof! the lighting was fine, but the air was very stuffy. It was however spacious and had a huge bathroom. The price is not equal to the service nor the attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Salamanca”
Reviews.Author: gaby64
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance and it was a great surprise. It is located in Salamanca, on quiet street and close to the best shopping (top brands) area. The service is top quality and the rooms comfortable and nicely decorated. A great value for money deal.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, bad service”
Reviews.Author: mcristo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days for work The lost our reservation at their restaurant we had made 2 months prior. Besides this their general attitude is not a hassle free smooth one expected at their rates. Had to spend time arguing over minor things Nice location Internet needs a login everytime but is incl Will never come back

Reviews.Title: “elegant boutique hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: pdepParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully and tastefully decorated. The staff is helpful, and always ready to help. The rooms are lovely, the bathrooms are large and all marble. Breakfast excellent with a lot of choice. The restaurant is part of the prestigious Relais et Châteaux. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of the Salamanca district.

Reviews.Title: “nice decor but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: 900lisa
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Unico for 4 nights and loved the neighborhood it's in, Salamanca, quite close to the museums and tourist sights of Madrid. The public rooms are lovely and there's a beautiful library with complimentary beverages and snacks. I also found the rooms to be attractive with high ceilings, hardwood floors and a nice-sized, modern bathroom. My main reason for not giving this hotel an excellent rating is that they advertise their garden rooms as being very quiet. The problem is that the garden doubled as a bar at night with loud music on two of the four nights i was there. I also feel their website is misleading as the picture of the garden is cropped to give the impression that it's private when, in fact, there are multi-storied buildings which are quite close. Also, closet space is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: Guru57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Unico for 6 nights in early April and enjoyed it immensely. The hotel has a friendly staff and excellent service. Our room (406) was very comfortable although you did have to watch your head on the slanted ceiling which had a skylight. The only limitation was the lack of adequate closet space required for 2 people. Located on a relatively quiet street north of the City centre in Salamanca, the Unico is in the midst of many high fashion stores and a quick 10 minute taxi ride to town. The wifi is free and the complimentary bottled water and chocolates are a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good”
Reviews.Author: Platinum99
Reviews.Content: Excellent attentive staff. Hotel is is super decorative order. The rooms are NOT small, they are very comfortable. Great location (quiet). Free Wi-fi. Enjoy. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid's best boutique hotel?”
Reviews.Author: keitharrowsmith
Reviews.Content: A very well run boutique hotel. Rooms are not the largest, and the internal soundproofing not the best, but everything else was excellent. I stayed in a room overlooking the courtyard - with sufficient double glazing to make sure no sounds disturbed us from the outside. The room and bathroom were designed well and up to the specification set out on the hotel's website. Lots of different types of rooms, rather than the normal split between standard / superior. Free wifi, bedside radio, blu ray player - bottled water - all great touches. A good selection from the cold breakfast buffet, but cheaper and more varied fare is available from many cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Begum I
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel unico over the easter weekend and the area was quiet quiete. Our room was upgraded to king but it was still small for that price. the rooms are clean, the hotel is just in the middle of all the shops and couple of good restaurants like ten con ten. the staff was very attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “stylish oasis”
Reviews.Author: joupy45
Reviews.Content: I discovered this "jewel" of a hotel, in a quiet street just off the Calle de Serrano, in Barrio Salamanca - excellent shopping district. Although I stayed single and for just one night, I was given a large room on the 3rd floor, overlooking the garden. The decoration of the hotel, which was originally a private mansion built at the turn of the XXth century, is exquisite - see the library on the ground floor! My room was cream and beige, with a touch of vivid orange. The staff was discreet, efficient and multilingual. I arrived mid-afternoon and was welcomed by a nice cup of tea with biscuits, as courtesy from the management! What a treat! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Joker37
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, stylish hotel where staff is very kind ans corteous. We stayed many times and we are considering going to any other hotel when in Madrid. Rooms are spacious, with light (better get a superior room) with view on the garden. It is quiet, discreet amd very well located. Best shopping and neighborhood in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: heatherbeckel
Reviews.Content: This is a very chic and sophisticated boutique, luxury hotel. The space is both beautiful and comfortable. The rooms and bathrooms are wonderfully appointed. And the hotel is in a great location on a quiet street in a high-end shopping district. They have a great massage therapist in their wellness center on-site. I highly recommend this hotel and have nothing negative to say!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful People!”
Reviews.Author: Jackg5450
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at Unico and I highly recommend this hotel! The property is located on a quiet street in the most fashionable shopping district of Madrid. It is quite literally surrounded by the best shops, restaurants, and tapas bars in the city. The hotel is very stylish but comfortable. The downstairs lobby has several comfortable libraries and breakfast is available downstairs in the restaurant. The rooms are modern, stylish and comfortable. My room had French doors that opened on to the inner courtyard. Wifi internet worked effectively. The best part of the experience were the people who went out of their way to accommodate our requests. Pedro was especially helpful with several items that made my stay even more satisfying and enjoyable. I spend 40 to 50 nights a year in many different hotels in the States and the EU and I rarely recommend one. Take my word for it-this is a great place to spend a week!

Reviews.Title: “A short break in Madrid turned into a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: joaovj
Reviews.Content: We booked this 5 star hotel for 2 nights (March/11), in the Salamanca district with another couple to enjoy the shopping area, the gastronomy and see a Real Madrid match. The Hotel has a perfect location as well as the bedrooms are very confortable. At arrival and after delivering to the staff our luggage, we were taken to the bedrooms. Later they came to deliver the luggage and my wife's bag - a Louis Vitton trolley - was missing. We came to the Reception and quickly they checked on the CCTV system that was robbed by a man inside the lobby. My wife lost all her valuable stuff and find herself with nothing to wear. The girl in the reception was very keen and full of attention to us, saying that it was the first time this ever happened there. We listed all the items in the luggage and she repeated that the Hotel would take care to reimburse all the losses. She passed us a letter confirming so. We went to the police to participate the robbery. The Director only showed up the following day, after our repeated request. He also repeated that the Hotel would fully reimburse our loss and gave us a second letter with all the items lost listed and valued. We believed him and their letters and managed the incident quitely to save the Hotel any inconvenience to other guests. He upgraded us the bedroom to a suite. My wife had to go shopping to assure to have the minimum stuff to wear during the stay. After we left, we start exchanging e-mails to make sure, the compensation would be settle asap. We sent all the documents and invoices to confirm the items we had lost, as requested. We had to hire a lawyer in Madrid to take care of this. After a few months we were compensated by the insurance company up to their limit (they say) in aproximately 40% of our direct loss. After more than 7 months the Hotel management is surprisingly denying to complete the remaining responsibilities, earlier fully accepted. No argument was ever or now presented to refuse the reimbursement. When one chooses a 5 star hotel we expect the best from the Hotel, the service, the security, the confort and also that they are up to their responsibilities. Even if we can understand that such a thing could happen in a Hotel, we were very disapointed and felt betrayed by the words and letters from the Hotel management. We are taking them into court...

Reviews.Title: “Early autumn in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PashaVK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights. Very convenient location, good parking for a car. Perfect service. Very large selection of restaurants and cafes around the hotel (if two Michelin stars for you is very expensive). Our room was on the third floor windows overlooking the street, sleeping comfortably at night and no annoying sounds we heard. Our son is very tired in time long walks around Madrid and in the afternoon we left him to rest in the room, at the reception he was given SPS 3, which allowed him to have a good time. Many thanks to Ruth García and other employees of the hotel in our comfortable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Really Excellent Hotel with a super culinery surprise”
Reviews.Author: B_Dublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in the Unico in the Salamanca region of Madrid in Mid July 2011. We had 2 rooms which were nicely decorated but as they were internally facing they were a little small. The rooms facing the courtyard are better. Booked it via Tablet hotels and got a very good deal which may be the reason we got these internal rooms. The only other annoying item was that one of the rooms had a shower inside the bath whcih you had to stand into which really isnt acceptable for 4/5 star hotels. Otherwise the location is really excellent for wandering the city especially the high end shopping. The staff were very pleasent and the reception rooms are really lovely to relax in after pounding the madrid streets. The best gem of this hotel is the really superb 2 michellin star restaurant on the courtyard level. Really superb (and we are big foodies) and superb value at €76 per person for a 7/8 courses. The chef takes your order and is really good about discussing what you may like. A really excellent experience if you like tasing menus. We had our tennage son with us who also really enjoyed the food. We also manged to keep him entertained with short museum visits as opposed to long haul sessions!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to start exploring Madrid !”
Reviews.Author: Agidmo
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is wonderful !! Lots of very good restaurants and shops nearby. It is within the walking distance to all major museums. We had the double room, which was really small; however nicely decorated. There was a strange smell in the lift (the lift itself was very tiny as well). The staff was very helpful and nice. We didn't eat at the hotel, as there are so many nice restaurants nearby, therefore I can't make any comment on the hotel's kitchen. To summarize - good place to start exploring Madrid; however probably if the weather is not so good - the hotel does not offer too much (like no pool).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel but still finding it's feet”
Reviews.Author: NLB101
Reviews.Content: This is a newly renovated boutique hotel that is yet to be entirely completed. As of July 2011, the promised spa had not opened. The rooms are lovely and the staff are very helpful. It is located in the shopping district which is a long walk or short cab ride away from the bustle of the Centro. Breakfast is average, which is suprising given it us produced by the Hotel's 2 Michelin star restaurant. I can't comment on the restaurant because we were unable to get a reservation during our 2 day stay, but it looked amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great rooms, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: olliedawg
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in Spain's most exclusive neighborhood, Barrio de Salamanca. The rooms are luxurious and spotless. There's a fancy-shmancy restaurant that we didn't try, as it was way too expensive for breakfast, and so much more in the area to choose from in terms of dinner. (By the way, NEVER take the breakfast deal at a Spanish hotel -- walk down the street or around the corner, as we did in this ultra-exclusive area, and you'll find LOTS of great little bars serving cheap desayunos, E3-6 per). What's really great is the neighborhood -- very upscale, quite posh, but not too snooty. Plus, there's a metro station 2 blocks away -- Madrid is huge and hot, take the subway all you can -- and lots of shopping and restaurants around. Viva Madrid!
